Key Match Events: The Cubs erupted for four runs in the 5th inning, including a sacrifice fly by Pete Crow-Armstrong and a run scored by Nico Hoerner on a groundout.
In the 7th inning, Hoerner singled and stole second base. He was tagged out, but the throw to second was wild, allowing the run to score.
In the 9th inning, Porter Hodge preserved the 5-3 victory by striking out Dylan Crews and James Wood.
Post-Match Reflections: The Cubs' defense erased two Washington runners on the basepaths.
The Cubs got another quality starting pitching performance and the lineup produced five runs.
Isaac Paredes reached base three times and is starting to come out of his slump.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Cubs beat the Nats for their fifth consecutive win and the eighth in their last nine games.
Hoerner had two hits and created a pair of crucial runs with his excellent baserunning.
The Cubs went 18-8 in the month of August, improving their chances of ending the season with a better record than 2023.
